intro: Jaubertia koelpiniodes, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, herbaceous stems. Jaubertia koelpiniodes is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
